com.netflix.msl.msg
Class MslControl.RequestService

java.lang.Object
  com.netflix.msl.msg.MslControl.RequestService
All Implemented Interfaces:
Callable<MslControl.MslChannel>
Enclosing class:
MslControl
private class MslControl.RequestService
extends Object
implements Callable<MslControl.MslChannel>

This service sends a request to the remote entity and returns the response.

This class will only be used by trusted network clients, peer-to-peer clients, and peer-to-peer servers.

Nested Class Summary
private  class MslControl.RequestService.DelayedInputStream
          A delayed input stream does not open the real input stream until one of its methods is called.

Method Detail

execute

private MslControl.MslChannel execute(MessageContext msgCtx,
                                      MessageBuilder builder,
                                      int timeout,
                                      int msgCount)
                               throws MslException,
                                      IOException,
                                      InterruptedException

Send the provided request and receive a response from the remote entity. Any necessary handshake messages will be sent.

If an error was received and cannot be handled the returned MSL channel will have null for its message output stream.

Parameters:
msgCtx - message context.
builder - request message builder.
timeout - renewal lock acquisition timeout in milliseconds.
msgCount - number of messages sent or received so far.
Returns:
the established MSL channel or null if cancelled or if the maximum message count is hit.
Throws:
MslException - if there was an error creating or processing a message.
IOException - if there was an error reading or writing a message.
InterruptedException - if the thread is interrupted while trying to acquire a master token's read lock.

call

public MslControl.MslChannel call()
                           throws MslException,
                                  IOException
Specified by:
call in interface Callable<MslControl.MslChannel>
Returns:
the established MSL channel or null if cancelled or interrupted.
Throws:
MslException - if there was an error creating or processing a message.
IOException - if there was an error reading or writing a message.
See Also:
Callable.call()
